text: Hi guys. So recently I decided to revert
back to my old ways, which basically
means just being my authentic self. And
the crazy thing is that people don't
like it. And I think it's really messed
up that, you know, I'm just genuinely
being myself and people are poking fun
at my personality and saying really
offensive things. But despite how
uncomfortable I may make them feel
because of my authentic presence, I
don't care. I'm just going to keep doing
what I'm doing. So, when I was going to
therapy, one of the things that my
therapist told me was that I can be
myself. And it's like crazy because it's
such a simple sentence, but for some
reason, I didn't really think of that
because my whole life people kept
telling me that I should change this and
that about myself and like I was never
good enough. Um, I remember like the
first time I got a job and I started
working, literally the first week I was
there, two people told me, "You don't
talk enough. There's something wrong
with you. We got to fix you." And like
someone like invited me to go to the
movies with them because they wanted to
get me out of my shell. And it was just
like really annoying because when people
treat me like that, they make me feel
like there's something wrong with me.
I've had so many people try to change
who I am. And I went almost my whole
life thinking that there was something
wrong with me, but really I'm just a
little bit different and that's okay. Um
anyway, um so I I really thought about
what my therapist said and I was like,
you know what, I am going to be myself.
So you know what I started doing? I
started being quiet because that is my
true authentic self. I like being quiet
when I'm at a party, like a a get
together or whatever. I don't like to
talk. I like to just sit there because
talking is very difficult for me. When
I'm talking to other people, talking in
front of the camera is one thing, but
when I'm having like a physical
discussion with people, I really
struggle with that, and I prefer just
not to say anything. To me, it just
comes more natural. I hate feeling like
I have to force myself to say things to
contribute to the conversation just to
feel normal. And I've been doing that
for quite a while. and it just it
doesn't suit me. I feel like I've been
pretending to be someone that I'm not
just so I can be normal and so I don't
offend people. And my therapist
reassured me that um if my quietness
makes other people uncomfortable, that's
on them. They can do what they want with
that with those emotions, but it doesn't
really reflect who I am as a person.
Like it's like yes, I'm quiet, but
that's my personality. So, I'm going to
keep being me and I'm not going to let
you people disrupt me from being my true
authentic self. And um this has just
been a lifelong struggle for me. Um
every single time I get out and I'm, you
know, around people, there's always
someone who has to comment on me being
quiet. Always, always, always without a
fail. And um people will just say like,
"Are you okay?" And I'm like, "Yeah."
And they're like, "Oh, you're not saying
anything.
I don't know what to tell you. I I have
nothing to say right now." People come
up to me and they ask me if I'm okay, if
I'm going to pass out, if I'm sick.
Everyone always says that I look really
tired. You know what? That's just my
face. That's just my personality. It's
just how I am. And somehow it really
bothers people because I feel like every
single time I'm at a get together,
there's guaranteed at least the bare
minimum one person that's going to say
something like that to me. And um lately
there's been someone in my life right
now who keeps saying that I have a poker
face and they won't stop saying it. And
my poker face really bothers them
because they said that they want to know
how I'm feeling. Well, you know what? If
I want to let you know how I feel, I
will do so. But please don't try to
force something out of me. This is my
authentic personality.
It's just I get it. A lot of people,
they're loud, they're expressive,
but that's just not who I am. And for
some reason, people just can't seem to
grasp that. So anyway, this person who
keeps calling me a poker face, I'm just
thinking like whatever. Like I don't
have to smile for you. I don't have to
get all loud and start talking. I don't
have to speak everything that's on my
mind and tell you how I feel and this
and that. And I just kind of feel like
people are nosy. And they just want to
know everything about me. They're like,
"What's she thinking?" or "Who is she?"
And I I don't know, like just let me
live. Like if if you really want to know
who I am, why don't you try to like
befriend me and stop pressuring me?
Because you want to know something? I
don't feel like being friends with
people that try to force something out
of me or change who I am. It just it
doesn't feel right when you're telling
me that there's something wrong with me
because I have a poker face or because
I'm quiet or whatever. Like that's just
not okay in my book. I really believe
that you should just let people be
themselves. So anyway, um I made this
decision that
I'm like done talking all the time and
pretending to be an extrovert when I'm
not. Um and I'm learning to be okay with
it and to not feel uncomfortable. And I
think I'm getting a little better at it
because it's just like
I feel like it's easier to just be
myself and sit there quietly than it was
to like force myself to create fake
conversations and just say things for
the sake of saying them, you know, to
seem normal. Um, so anyway, I'm kind of
excited because I really feel like
being yourself is just one of the best
things that you can do. I just I feel
like it just makes your quality of life
better and I'm really excited about
that. I feel like it's been really
draining um listening to other people
criticizing me and then me trying so
hard to like change my personality when
it's like almost impossible. Like it's
really hard to go against your own
nature and to be someone that you're
not. It's it's difficult. And despite
the training that I did, like trying my
hardest
I still struggled. And you know that's
okay because that's literally not me.
I'd rather just be good at what I'm
doing, which is just kind of being
quiet, just kind of sitting in the
corner. I like to watch and listen, but
having conversations with people is
difficult. And yeah, so
right now it's, you know, kind of
difficult because people are still
poking fun at me. People make fun of my
personality and say there's something
wrong with me. So, I get it. I make
people uncomfortable. I make them upset,
whatever. But, you know what? That is
totally on them. And I'm just going to
keep doing what I'm doing. So, I just
kind of wanted to share that message
because I bet you
um there's a lot of introverts that can
relate to that. Um, I think a lot of my
audience, I think a lot of you guys are
introverts and I'm sure you've heard it
more than once or twice in your life
that people are saying that you're a
problem and there's something wrong with
you and you need to talk more and, you
know,
just just ignore them, you know, cuz you
can't stop what they're saying. it's
going to keep happening, but you can
just push those thoughts aside and just
continue living your life the way you
want to without thinking that there's
something wrong with you. And I think
that's really special and I think it
takes a lot of inner strength to do
that. So, um, yeah, I just I guess I
want to encourage my fellow introverts
to keep being themselves because there's
nothing wrong with that. You're just
being yourself.
So, let me know in the comments if you
guys can relate to that. And thank you
guys so much for watching. Bye.
